title: Pics: Milind Soman completes the most difficult marathon in the world | Hindi Movie News - Times of India
text: Emotional Anil Kapoor breaks down at 'Mirzya' music launch event Pics: Milind Soman completes the most difficult marathon in the world Milind Soman has been bestowed upon the title of ‘Ultraman’– an honour reserved for those who survive the most difficult marathon in the world. TNN | Feb 22, 2017, 01.41 PM IST Milind Soman, who was already the 'Iron Man' of India, has now been bestowed upon the title of 'Ultraman' - an honour reserved for those who survive the most difficult marathon in the world. Watch: Milind Soman's mom joins him on his run, barefoot The actor-model-fitness promoter completed the Florida Ultraman marathon over the course of three days. The 517.5-kilometre event covers swimming, cycling and running in parts. Milind posted pictures from his run through Florida . The 51-year-old also had his mother with him at the event. His mother is also an avid runner, and has participated in marathons with the actor in the past. A post shared by Milind Usha Soman (@milindrunning) on Feb 21, 2017 at 8:09pm PST A post shared by Milind Usha Soman (@milindrunning) on Feb 19, 2017 at 9:49pm PST A post shared by Milind Usha Soman (@milindrunning) on Feb 19, 2017 at 7:24am PST Four other Indians completed the marathon - Abhishek Mishra , Kaustubh Radkar , Prithviraj Patil and Manmadh Rebba . The Florida Ultraman's first day comprised a 10-kilometre swim and a 148-kilometre bike ride. The second day saw a 276-kilometre bike ride and the final day covered an 84-kilometre run.
